title: Project Ashe's arrow needs to be more visible on Summoner's Rift.
body: I'm colorblind, and Project Ashe's ultimate blends in extremely well with the grass on Summoner's Rift. The arrow is also very wispy looking, and that makes it even harder to see. I've been hit with so many ults from Project Ashe simply because I was unable to see them, especially when I'm focusing on something else. Please change the color, make it less wispy, or somehow more distinguishable for colorblind (or even non-colorblind) players like me.

replies.body:
My only problem is the arrow doesn't look like an arrow, it looks just like a massive energy cloud. Although I'm not dumb and can identify it as the ult, my reaction time to that is much slower than any other skin. They could've made it cool and Project-y but still retained the look of an arrow.


Although not color blind, I understand where your frustration is coming from and I would not be surprised if League made visual changes soon.
Yeah, the fact that it's an energy cloud what what I meant when I referred to it as "wispy looking". If it were still an arrow, I would definitely be able to tell it was an Ashe ult.

Indeed. Because it looks less like an Ashe ult, it takes longer to react to it. Also, I have flashed from project Ashe's E because it looks very much alike (although a lot smaller but when you need to make a decision instantly, you sometimes don't think clearly) which I never did anytime before.

Contrast is even worse, the slightest contrast changes hurt my eyes if it isn't near perfect.

But I can see how it could be a problem. It's always good to have a color blind graphic designer around. When I was in school for graphic design, I liked to work with someone that was colorblind in my class. I would always adjust my designs to be in his favor.
